item.title: By: celerie
item.dc:creator: celerie
item.description:
i think ppl have this fantasy about the perfect raid guild where everyone logs on at the right time, ppl know their class, bring their own consumables, etc. personally, i don't believe that guild exists. you just can't get 25 ppl scattered over the globe to act with that kind of synchronization. getting them to do ANYTHING together is part of the challenge of the game, imo.
regarding ppl's comments about /o: my old guild grew to be two guilds in one. you had the ppl in /o and the ppl in /gu, and the /o ppl absolutely bitched about the /gu ppl. it was bad for the guild and eventually turned into a split. the /o ppl left (and formed my current guild) and the /gu ppl had to pick up the pieces.
i learned from the experience. when i formed my new guild, i set the ranks to be officer-free. we have two active GMs and, when it's raid time, a channel for raid assistants that acts as a temporary /o just for that raid (tank assistant, dps, healing. that's it).
imo, it's really cut down on the level of drama caused by cliques and secrecy.
